connector.description: Generate messages in specified intervals using java.util.Timer.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.delay.name: camel.source.endpoint.delay
camel.source.endpoint.delay.description: Delay before first event is triggered.

camel.source.endpoint.fixedRate.name: camel.source.endpoint.fixedRate
camel.source.endpoint.fixedRate.description: Events take place at approximately regular intervals, separated by the specified period.

camel.source.endpoint.includeMetadata.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeMetadata
camel.source.endpoint.includeMetadata.description: Whether to include metadata in the exchange such as fired time, timer name, timer count etc. This information is default included.

camel.source.endpoint.period.name: camel.source.endpoint.period
camel.source.endpoint.period.description: If greater than 0, generate periodic events every period.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the timer will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.daemon.name: camel.source.endpoint.daemon
camel.source.endpoint.daemon.description: Specifies whether or not the thread associated with the timer endpoint runs as a daemon. The default value is true.

camel.source.endpoint.pattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.pattern
camel.source.endpoint.pattern.description: Allows you to specify a custom Date pattern to use for setting the time option using URI syntax.

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used

camel.source.endpoint.time.name: camel.source.endpoint.time
camel.source.endpoint.time.description: A java.util.Date the first event should be generated. If using the URI, the pattern expected is: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.

camel.component.timer.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.timer.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.timer.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.timer.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.timer.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.timer.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
